item.title: 最高法院推翻雪佛龙案对企业的启示
item.description:
此外，卡瓦的首席财务官还介绍了连锁餐厅的发展情况。【原文：

Plus, Cava’s CFO dishes on the restaurant chain’s growth.

】

item.title: 日本机场为何出现航空燃油短缺？快讯
item.description: 就在游客蜂拥而至，寻求享受历史上最廉价的日元时，日本的航空燃油短缺却阻碍了外国航空公司的发展，并有可能抑制旅游业的繁荣。燃料短缺促使政府采取行动，成立了一个跨部委和私营部门的特别工作组。【原文：A jet fuel shortage in Japan is hampering foreign airlines and threatening to curtail a tourism boom just as travelers are flocking to the country seeking to take advantage of a historically cheap yen. The scarcity of fuel has spurred the government into action, forming a task force across different ministries and the private sector.】

item.title: 投资者对拜登退出有何反应
item.description: 随着夏季的全面启动，市场已经有很多事情要处理，从评估美联储的降息路径到财报季的核心内容。但是，2024 年的总统竞选一直是市场关注的焦点。【原文：Markets already had plenty to deal with as summer kicks into full gear, from assessing the Federal Reserve’s rate-cut path to the heart of earnings season. But 2024’s presidential race keeps crowding into the headlines.】

item.title: 拜登退出让市场追问 "特朗普贸易 "下一步何去何从
item.description: 本周伊始，投资者们将争先恐后地判断，乔-拜登总统决定结束连任竞选活动并为副总统卡马拉-哈里斯背书，这是否会增加或减少唐纳德-特朗普重新掌权的机会。【原文：Investors are set to start the week scrambling to decide if President Joe Biden’s decision to end his reelection campaign and endorse Vice President Kamala Harris increases or decreases Donald Trump’s chances of regaining power.】

item.title: 更大的债务负担和反复无常的政治困扰着债券市场
item.description: 债券市场的震荡相隔两个星期、两个大洲。【原文：The bond-market tremors came two weeks and two continents apart.】

item.title: 秘密银行评级显示美国监管机构对处理风险的关注
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国一家重要的监管机构私下发现，在其监管的主要银行中，有一半对从网络攻击到员工失误等各种潜在风险的把握不足。【原文：A key US regulator has privately found half of the major banks it oversees have an inadequate grasp of a broad swath of potential risks from cyber attacks to employee blunders, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 保时捷希望扩大与电池制造商 Varta 的合作
item.description: 据知情人士透露，保时捷公司正在考虑在拯救陷入困境的电池生产商瓦尔塔公司（Varta AG）的过程中扮演更重要的角色。【原文：Porsche AG is considering taking a bigger role in the rescue of the embattled battery producer Varta AG, according to people familiar.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数下一轮上涨取决于受挫股票能否复仇
item.description: 随着交易员对不久的将来降息越来越有信心，大科技股以外的股市正一路走高，这也燃起了人们对牛市再起波澜的希望。【原文：Corners of the stock market outside of Big Tech are barreling higher as traders grow more confident about interest-rate cuts in the near future — fueling hopes that another leg of the bull run could be in the offing.】

item.title: 五张图表说明中国为何需要解决财政问题
item.description: 上周在北京召开的政治会议的重要成果之一是决定让中央政府增加支出，以减轻资金紧张的地方政府的负担。【原文：One of the big outcomes of the political meeting in Beijing last week was a decision to have the central government spend more to reduce the burden on cash-strapped local governments.】

item.title: 收益率猎手瞄准新兴市场公司债券，美联储和美国投票盖住涨势
item.description: 投资者对新兴市场公司债券的选择越来越多，他们认为只有少数公司债券能继续提供丰厚的回报，并在下半年的货币政策动荡中保持稳定。【原文：Investors are turning more selective on emerging-market corporate bonds, betting that only a few will continue to provide strong returns and insulation from monetary policy turmoil in what’s expected to be a volatile second half of the year.】

item.title: 几乎 "所有加密货币从业者都是特朗普第二次执政的赢家
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）第二任总统任期内，比特币矿工和加密货币公司在美国上市的努力受阻，最终可能成为数字资产世界的最大赢家。面临失去市场份额风险的外国公司可能最终成为最大的输家。【原文：Bitcoin miners and crypto companies that have been stonewalled in efforts to go public in the US may ultimately be the biggest winners in the digital-asset world under a second Donald Trump presidency. Foreign companies at risk of losing market share may end up being the biggest losers.】

item.title: 受停电影响的伊拉克开始利用新线路进口土耳其电力
item.description: 土耳其和伊拉克之间一条计划了 20 年的输电线路开始运行，有可能帮助这个产油的阿拉伯国家解决严重的停电问题。【原文：An electricity-transmission line between Turkey and Iraq that’s been planned for 20 years began operating, potentially helping the oil-producing Arab nation tackle grueling power outages.】

item.title: 欧洲央行不急于决定降息，Makhlouf 告诉 Examiner
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员加布里埃尔-马克鲁夫（Gabriel Makhlouf）认为，欧洲中央银行不需要迅速采取利率行动。【原文：Rapid interest-rate action from the European Central Bank isn’t required, according to Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf.】

item.title: 中国共产党三中全会关于改革的决议要点
item.description: 中国于周日全文公布了《中共中央关于进一步深化改革推进中国现代化若干重大问题的决定》，这是中共中央在上周召开的全会上讨论的政策。【原文：China published the full text on Sunday of the decision on further deepening reform and advancing Chinese modernization, the policies discussed at a plenum held last week by the central committee of the Chinese Communist Party.】

item.title: 中国将完善金融业监管机制
item.description: 根据执政的中国共产党为世界第二大经济体制定的长期规划，中国将完善对价值 66 万亿美元的金融部门的监管机制，并规范各种金融活动。【原文：China will improve its supervision mechanism for the $66 trillion financial sector and regulate all sorts of financial activities, according to the ruling Communist Party’s long-term plan for the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 习近平在新经济蓝图中承诺为地方政府提供更多支持
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平承诺加大对地方政府的支持力度，深化税制改革，执政的中国共产党公布了世界第二大经济体的长期计划。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping pledged to increase support for local governments and deepen tax reform, as the ruling Communist Party unveiled its long-term plan for the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 马来西亚拦截新加坡大火中失踪的油轮
item.description: 马来西亚海事当局称，一艘油轮于周日凌晨离开新加坡以东发生碰撞和火灾的地点，在马来西亚沿海被拦截。【原文：An oil tanker that left the site of a collision and fire east of Singapore has been intercepted off the coast of Malaysia in the early hours of Sunday, Malaysian maritime authorities said.】

item.title: 丹格特因垄断指控将取消钢铁投资
item.description: 非洲首富阿里科-丹格特（Aliko Dangote）正在取消在尼日利亚投资新钢铁厂的计划，因为尼日利亚政府指责他试图通过在西非国家新建炼油厂实现垄断。【原文：Aliko Dangote, Africa’s richest man, is calling off plans to invest in a new steel plant in Nigeria after the government accused him of seeking to become a monopoly with his new refinery in the West African nation.】

item.title: 贝利的 "沉默对待 "引发英国央行 8 月降息悬念
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）两个月来的沉默，让人们在猜测利率发生关键性变化的时机时，没有太多的依据。【原文：Two months of silence from Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey have left anyone guessing the timing of a crucial change in interest rates with not much to go on.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚石油公司寻求立法降低租金和电价
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）表示，哥伦比亚的电费和租金价格是通货膨胀的主要驱动因素，政府希望立法者修改规范此类成本的立法。【原文：Colombia’s electricity tariffs and rental prices are the main drivers of inflation, and the government wants lawmakers to change legislation that regulate such costs, President Gustavo Petro said.】

item.title: 服务于非洲的评级公司将于明年准备就绪
item.description: 非洲联盟一位官员周六表示，为满足非洲主权借款人的独特需求而成立的信用评级公司将于明年准备就绪。【原文：A credit ratings company being established to meet the unique needs of Africa’s sovereign borrowers is set to be ready by next year, an African Union official said Saturday.】

item.title: 工党将与英国养老金主管讨论 "大爆炸 "改革
item.description: 英国工党新政府将于周一会见养老金行业的老板们，以促进经济增长并为储蓄提供更好的回报。【原文：Britain’s new Labour government will meet pensions industry bosses on Monday in an effort to boost economic growth and deliver better returns on savings.】

item.title: 美国通胀下行将使美联储更加放心
item.description: 有新的迹象表明，通胀正在减弱，经济活动正在放缓，未来一周美联储降息的进程将更加引人注目。【原文：The runway toward a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut will come more into focus in the coming week amid fresh signs inflation is abating and economic activity is simmering down.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易引发投资者抢购垃圾债和工业品
item.description: 信贷界版的 "特朗普交易 "已初具雏形：购买美国高收益债券，远离任何对通胀敏感的债券。【原文：The credit world’s version of the “Trump trade” is beginning to take shape: Buy American high-yield bonds and steer clear of anything inflation-sensitive.】

item.title: 阿塞拜疆可能在俄罗斯协议结束后通过乌克兰出口天然气
item.description: 阿塞拜疆总统伊利哈姆-阿利耶夫说，乌克兰和欧盟已与阿塞拜疆接洽，希望在与俄罗斯的现有合同于今年年底到期后，通过乌克兰向欧洲供应天然气。【原文：Azerbaijan has been approached by Ukraine and the European Union to supply natural gas to Europe via Ukraine after an existing contract with Russia expires at the end of the year, President Ilham Aliyev said.】

item.title: 尼日利亚丹格特炼油厂目标日产量达 55 万桶
item.description: 尼日利亚丹格特炼油厂的所有者阿里科-丹格特（Aliko Dangote）表示，该厂计划在 9 月前达到至少 60% 的装机容量，并在年底前达到每天 55 万桶的产量。【原文：Nigeria’s Dangote Refinery plans to hit at least 60% of its installed capacity by September and reach 550,000 barrels a day by the end of the year, owner Aliko Dangote said.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金提议将其在塞尔福里奇的股份增至 50
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的文件，沙特阿拉伯公共投资基金已提出收购要约，将其在塞尔福里奇百货公司（Selfridges）的股份增至 50%，此前这家英国百货公司的共同所有者已陷入破产。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund has made an offer that would boost its stake in Selfridges to 50%, according to documents seen by Bloomberg News, after the UK department store’s co-owner fell into insolvency.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉反对派依靠公民保护 7 月 28 日的投票
item.description: 由于国际社会对委内瑞拉即将举行的选举几乎没有监督，公民证人网络是反对党将篡改选票风险降至最低的最大希望。【原文：With very little international oversight of Venezuela’s upcoming election, a network of citizen witnesses is the opposition party’s best hope of minimizing the risk of vote tampering.】

item.title: 大型科技股暴跌加大盈利压力
item.description: 对于科技巨头来说，进入本财报季的风险已经很高。在纳斯达克 100 指数经历了三个月来最糟糕的一周之后，它们的赌注变得更大了。【原文：The stakes were already elevated for technology giants heading into this earnings season. They just got a lot higher after the worst week for the Nasdaq 100 Index in three months.】

item.title: 加密货币行业希望特朗普获胜并取消美国证券交易委员会（SEC
item.description: 加密货币行业希望即将到来的美国总统大选能让一位在执法问题上态度更温和的人入主白宫，从而结束与华尔街最高层警察的长期斗争。【原文：The cryptocurrency industry is hoping the upcoming US presidential election will put someone in the White House who has a softer approach on enforcement, thereby ending prolonged battles with Wall Street’s top cop.】
